page.title: 17TOURISM IN RAVENGLASS
page.content: Many residents of Ravenglass rely on the tourist trade for their living either through bed and breakfast or because they own shops in the village. Recent adverse publicity about BNFL, who have a large site at Sellafield, 10 miles to the north has led to a drop in the number of tourists visiting and staying in the area.This has affected the livelihood of many people living in Ravenglass. BNFL is the largest employer in West Cumbria.They monitor the beaches and estuary very thoroughly but despite these precautions sale of locally caught fish has fallen greatly.At present there is controversy over the reason for the decline in the numbers of breeding sea-birds. Untreated sewage is also pumped out to sea but,despite this,Ravenglass has a large percentage of elderly residents.
